    		Department of Economics
    	
                        Our Programs
                    
                        What Our Grads Are Doing
                    
                        Explore Careers
                    We are a growing and vibrant department providing the highest quality education, with faculty actively participating in scholarship.  Scholarship activities of our faculty members include environmental and natural resource economics, international and development economics, energy economics, economic history and economic policy. Given the breadth of expertise of our faculty, we are able to offer a wide range of courses. Our faculty is committed to foster a strong sense of community, and students enjoy extensive interaction with faculty members.  The Department of Economics at Chico State University is committed to student intellectual development. The faculty members engage their students in research projects on topics that include important contributions to local, regional, national, and international issues and policy analysis.Advising Schedule for Spring 2023Department Chair and Advisor:  Pete Tsournos, ptsournos@csuchico.eduMondays and Wednesday 11:00-12:00 – In-person appointment via Bookings (link below)Wednesdays 3:15-4:30 – Zoom appointment via Bookings (link below)You can sign up for the appointment via the link below.  Be sure to click on the type of advising you are booking, Virtual or In-person, at the top of the page.  This will allow you to see available time slots. Click here to schedule an appointment for Econ advising.If you don’t see a time that works for you, please email Kathy at kjwilliams@csuchico.edu and she will help find an alternative time that will work for both you and Pete.Look what Economics Honors Students are doing!2022 Honors Students Abstract of ResearchFood Insecurity, Income Volatility, and Liquidity Constraints By: Faith FatchenInvestigating Changes in Bitcoin Price Dynamics Following Covid-19 By: Sean LytleDoes Veteran Status Impact Wages? By: Jacob MackinDo MLB Players Perform Better Against Their Former Team?  By: Trevor RodriguezDo Mid-Season Coaching Changes Effect Player Performance In The NBA?By: Vanesa RodriguezCollege of Behavioral & Social SciencesButte Hall, Room 701530-898-6171bss@csuchico.eduwww.csuchico.edu/bssSupport Our CollegeProgram PortfolioBSS Majors & ProgramsAnthropologyChild DevelopmentEconomicsGeography & PlanningPublic Health & Health Services AdministrationMulticultural & Gender StudiesPolitical Science & Criminal JusticePsychologySocial ScienceSocial WorkSociology
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
